title: Five dead after plane ‘runs out of fuel’ and crashes into field
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

At least five people have died after a Ukrainian plane was forced to make an emergency landing when it is believed to have run out of fuel.

The Antonov-12 cargo plane came down just over a mile from the runway in Lviv today, following a flight from Vigo in Spain.

Earlier the aircraft had vanished from radar some eight and a half miles from the airport.

Pictures from the scene, close to a cemetery in the village of Sokylniki, show severe damage to the craft’s cockpit, wings and engines and the rough ground where the plane came to a halt.

Three survivors have reportedly been injured and taken to hospital, though the seriousness of their conditions is unknown.

The plane is thought to have landed just 1.5 miles from its destination in Western Ukraine (Picture: EPA)

The plane had been in service since 1968 (Picture: EPA)

Emergency services said there was no fire after the crash (Picture: EPA)

Seven crew members and one person accompanying the unidentified cargo were on board the flight.

One injured crew member called the emergency services to say the plane had made an emergency landing.

A statement from regional emergency services said earlier: ‘Burning is not observed. The crew is being removed from the damaged aircraft.’

Infrastructure Minister Kryklii said the aircraft was planning a refuelling stop before travelling on to Istanbul, adding that an investigation is underway.

The four-engined plane was originally a Soviet air force aircraft used around the world for cargo transport. It had been in service since 1968.

Lviv Airport was closed because of the crash.

The cockpit was severely damaged in today’s crash (Picture: EPA)

Three people have been taken to hospital and five have died (Picture: EPA)

Rescuers work at the plane crash site in a forest outside Lviv (Picture: AFP)

The flight was stopping in Lviv en route to Istanbul (Picture: AFP)

description: Ukrainian cargo Antonov-12 plane came down near Lviv, killing five and injuring three, ahead of a refuelling stop before flying to Istanbul.
